brief_description: Project 1: Immunologic and genomic signatures of influenza vaccine response  - year5 2014
brief_title: Immunologic and genomic signatures of influenza vaccine response - 2014
condition_studied: Immunologic and genomic signatures of influenza vaccine response
description: Project 1: Immunologic and genomic signatures of influenza vaccine response  - year5 2014
endpoints: B cells (ASC, Memory); T cells (Ag specific CD8 and CD4, memory T cell subsets, Tregs, exhausted/senescent); in vitro activation of flu-specific T cells; Monocyte/DC stim by flu or through TLRs; innate cell TLR expression; Luminex assays of cytokines post vaccine; Illumina HT12 bead chip and Nanostring.
hypothesis: Define signatures for immune responsiveness by functional systems immunology
objectives: Identification of immunologic, gene expression, and genetic loci signatures of vaccine response, and effects of aging and functional status on these signatures.
official_title: Immunologic and genomic signatures of influenza vaccine response - 2014

program.contract_name: Defining signatures for immune responsiveness by functional systems immunology HIPC1
